author: NY Weekly Staff
title: Jay Chou: From Dior Ambassador to Christmas Star – A Festive Melody Unveiled
text:
‘King of Mandopop’ composes first Christmas-themed song
Mandopop’s Reigning King Jay Chou, recently crowned as DIOR’s newest global ambassador, is set to dazzle the world this Christmas season with his first holiday-themed single, ‘Christmas Star.’ Completing his electrifying ‘Carnival’ world tour in Bangkok, Jay Chou’s stage presence was accentuated by a series of stunning outfits, exclusively designed by DIOR’s Creative Director, Kim Jones, highlighting the singer’s new role with the fashion giant.
The ‘King of Mandopop’ presents this new single as a heartfelt Christmas gift to his fans worldwide, crafted amidst a whirlwind of activities including his recent partnership with Universal Music Group, his ongoing Netflix series “J-Style Trip 2,” and his ambassadorial duties for Dior. This new Christmas tune is poised to be a festive addition to holiday playlists globally.
Returning to Thailand after years, Jay Chou’s recent concerts saw over 70,000 fans, setting a record at the Rajamangala National Stadium. His album “Greatest Works of Art” broke records last year, placing a Mandarin artist in the top 10 of the IFPI 2022 Global Artist Chart and topping the Global Album Sales Chart for the first time. His contributions to film and art, including roles in “The Green Hornet” and “Now You See Me 2,” as well as collaborations with Christie’s and Sotheby’s, reflect his limitless approach to life and art.
The ‘Christmas Star’ music video, set in a picturesque European town, features Jay Chou in a cabin adorned with Christmas decorations, marking Jay Chou’s first foray into writing a song specifically for the Christmas season.
“This Christmas, Jay is set to enrich the holiday repertoire with his new single ‘Christmas Star.’ His fans are eagerly anticipating more influential works that will further elevate his artistic and cultural impact around the world.”
https://www.instagram.com/jaychou/

author: @TIMESNOW
title: Bangalore Weather: Rain Brings Relief From Heat, Humidity To Rise; IMD Forecast Rainfall Today And Tomorrow in THESE Areas of Karnataka-See Details | Times Now
text:
Bengaluru To Get Very Humid As IMD Forecasts More Rain In City & THESE Districts-See When
Bengaluru Rains: Bengaluru witnessed its first rainfall in two months, with light showers recorded in 14 wards. The IMD has forecast more rain in the evenings over the next two days, accompanied by high humidity levels.
Rain in Bengaluru: Brace for Humid Days as Rains Return (Canva)
Bengaluru: After a dry spell lasting nearly two months and dealing with one of its hottest Februarys, Bengaluru witnessed light showers in 14 wards on Tuesday evening, marking the city’s first rainfall in weeks. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has now forecast light rain in the evenings over the next two days, bringing some relief to the residents. Residents can expect an on-and-off rainy week.
First Showers After Dry Spell
On Tuesday, parts of Bengaluru recorded 0.64 mm of rainfall during a brief drizzle. The highest rainfall was reported at Doddanekundi in the Mahadevapura zone, which received 1.5 mm of rain, as per TIE report. This light shower followed two months of no rainfall, during which temperatures steadily climbed, making the downpour a welcome change for many.High Humidity Expected
While the rain offered some relief, the city is expected to experience high humidity levels over the next two days. According to IMD, humidity could reach up to 99 per cent, with light rain predicted on Wednesday and Thursday evenings. During this period, maximum temperatures are likely to hover around 32 deg C, while the minimum may drop to 20 deg C.Forecast for South Interior Karnataka
The IMD's forecast also includes several other districts in South Interior Karnataka. "Isolated light rain/thundershowers very likely to occur over Kolar, Bengaluru Urban, Bengaluru Rural, Chikkaballapura, Tumkur, Ramanagara, Mandya, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, Kodagu, and Hassan," the IMD stated. Additionally, light rain is expected in parts of Coastal Karnataka, including Dakshina Kannada and Udupi, while the rest of the state is predicted to remain dry.Bengaluru's Rainfall Trends
Historically, Bengaluru receives minimal rainfall in January and February. Data from 1991 to 2020 indicates that March sees a slight increase in rainfall, with an average of 1.7 rainy days. In comparison, January and February average only 0.2 and 0.3 rainy days, respectively. The wettest months for Bengaluru are August (10.2 rainy days), September (9.5), and October (9.6), contributing to an annual average of 62.6 rainy days.As Bengaluru residents prepare for damp yet humid weather in the coming days, the forecasted rain may offer some comfort amid the rising temperatures.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: ONG advierte de "peligros" para Latinoamérica por acciones militares de Venezuela y Guyana
text:
Caracas, 28 dic (EFE).- La vuelta de las tensiones entre Venezuela y Guyana supone "enormes peligros" para la región, debido a la llegada de un buque de guerra británico a las costas guyanesas, a lo que el Gobierno de Nicolás Maduro respondió con una "acción defensiva" de la Fuerza Armada, advirtió este jueves la ONG Control Ciudadano.
La directora de la organización no gubernamental, Rocío San Miguel, se refirió a las declaraciones que diera hoy el presidente de Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, en las que habló de una "ruptura" de lo pactado, por parte de su par guyanés, Irfaan Ali, el pasado 14 de diciembre, cuando acordaron no amenazarse mutuamente y evitar incidentes.
"Considera Venezuela que está rota la declaración de Argyle (...) eso encierra enormes peligros para la paz y la estabilidad de la región", dijo a EFE San Miguel, quien cree que los ejercicios militares ordenados por Maduro, en respuesta a la "amenaza" de Reino Unido, empezaron hoy y durarán hasta que el HMS Trent de la Armada británica se vaya de las costas guyanesas.
Sin embargo, el Gobierno guyanés afirmó que está comprometido con lo acordado con Maduro, y que la llegada del buque es "una rutina" y algo "planificado desde hace mucho tiempo, que forma parte de la construcción de la capacidad defensiva de Guyana".
Según la analista, con el despliegue militar -que incluye 5.682 "combatientes", 28 aeronaves y 16 embarcaciones, entre otras maquinarias-, Venezuela "está mostrando sus dientes" y exhibiendo su capacidad operativa, así como su "disposición de patrullaje y de vigilancia".
Los ejercicios, que se llevan a cabo en el estado Sucre (noreste), a cientos de kilómetros de Guyana, son la respuesta de Venezuela ante la negativa de Georgetown de impedir la llegada del buque británico.
San Miguel cree que, como no se conoce cuánto durarán las maniobras venezolanas, estas pudieran coincidir con ejercicios del lado guyanés a principios de enero, lo que configuraría "un escenario de claras tensiones militares de carácter regional".
La disputa territorial escaló luego de que Venezuela aprobara el 3 de diciembre, en un referendo unilateral, anexionarse la zona bajo pleito, un área de casi 160.000 kilómetros cuadrados que está bajo control de Guyana y cuya controversia está en manos de la Corte Internacional de Justicia. EFE
hp/sb/laa
